node.title: Defense in George Floyd civil rights trial says his death was a tragedy, not a crime
node.description: Prosecutors have argued that the officers violated their training by not rolling Floyd onto his side or giving him CPR.

node.title: Stocks drop as Ukraine turmoil threatens global economy
node.description: Crisis in Ukraine yet another worry for companies facing supply-chain woes, higher costs and Fed interest rate hikes.

node.title: What to know about new U.S. sanctions targeting Russia over Ukraine
node.description: The penalties announced by the president are the "first tranche of sanctions" on Russia for its latest actions against Ukraine.

node.title: Image shows two Black Hawk helicopters crashed near Utah ski resort
node.description: No crew members were injured.

node.title: Biden says Russia has begun "invasion" of Ukraine and U.S. is imposing sanctions
node.description: "Whatever Russia does next, we're ready to respond with unity, clarity and conviction," President Biden said.

node.title: Officers working at Wellington protest have caught Covid-19 - Coster
node.description: Police Commissioner Andrew Coster says a team of staff working at the protest have caught Covid-19 and while it hasn't been linked to protesters, it "stands to reason" the coronavirus is there. Audio

node.title: No, higher worker pay isn't the main driver of U.S. inflation
node.description: Although companies blame higher worker pay for surging consumer prices, their profits tell a different story.

node.title: 'Difficult trying to adapt': High schoolers shoulder burden of pandemic changes
node.description: As high schools around New Zealand prepare for a third year of interrupted learning due to Covid-19, some educators are concerned about the lasting impacts of the pandemic on young people. Audio

node.title: 17-year-old girl charged after accidentally killing woman while hunting
node.description: After being initially treated for shock, the alleged shooter was taken into custody for questioning before being released.

node.title: Special space allocated for manus after near drowning
node.description: An area of the outdoor pool at WhakatƒÅne Aquatic Centre has been set aside for manus (bombing) after a nine-year-old boy nearly drowned last month.

node.title: How the Parliament protest unfolded on day 15
node.description: The behaviour by protesters outside Parliament has been condemned as "absolutely disgraceful" by police leaders today. Audio

node.title: Expectations for Covid care ignore stretched workforce - NZMA
node.description: The Medical Association is warning all doctors that the impact of Covid-19 on general practice is at crisis point.

node.title: Nearly half of 140,000 who went on strike in 2021 work in health care
node.description: In strikes during the pandemic, most were fighting for better pay.

node.title: Southern DHB expects Covid-19 cases to be double official figure
node.description: Southern District Health Board estimates there are close to 1200 cases of Covid-19 in its region, much more than the official figure of 690.

node.title: New nationwide helpline to offer prescriptions for abortions
node.description: A free 24-hour abortion helpline will be rolled out nationwide where people can be prescribed medication over the phone to end unwanted pregnancies.

node.title: Auckland Hospital nurses working extra to provide safe level of care
node.description: An Auckland Hospital nurse says his colleagues are working extra shifts or doing different jobs as Covid-19 takes a toll on staffing and case numbers rise.

node.title: Mosque attack victims' families ask coroner to review country's gun licensing system
node.description: Lawyers for the families of people killed in the Christchurch mosque attacks have told a hearing a coronial inquiry must examine the country's defective gun licensing regime.

node.title: Rioter who took Pelosi's lectern should get 90 days in prison, feds say
node.description: A photo of Johnson carrying the podium went viral, and in texts following the insurrection he told people he "broke the internet" and was "finally famous," according to prosecutors.

node.title: Russia-Ukraine crisis will have an "impact on Americans," Rubio says
node.description: Oil prices are near $100 a barrel‚Äîtheir highest level since 2014

node.title: Covid-19: Advertising watchdog investigating vaccine 'risks' billboard in Auckland
node.description: The advertising watchdog is looking into a billboard using the image of a Dunedin man who died after getting a Covid-19 vaccine.

node.title: Second Moana Pasifika game postponed
node.description: Moana Pasifika's Super Rugby Pacific game against the Chiefs this weekend has been postponed because of player welfare concerns.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden updates nation as U.S. vows new Russia sanctions
node.description: President Biden is speaking as Ukraine's defense minister says Russia has "taken another step towards the revival of the Soviet Union."

node.title: Kids' mental health takes toll on parents' work, survey finds
node.description: The survey ‚Äî from the child advocacy group On Our Sleeves ‚Äî found that 53% of parents have missed work at least once a month to deal with their children's mental health.

node.title: Djokovic happy with his return to tennis
node.description: World number one Novak Djokovic belatedly began his 2022 campaign with a convincing defeat of Italian teenager Lorenzo Musetti at the Dubai Championships.

node.title: Video shows U.S. Coast Guard rescuing shark bite victim
node.description: A fishing boat crew called the Coast Guard after tightening a tourniquet around the man's arm "to prevent further blood loss."

node.title: "Family Reunion" actress Jaida Benjamin found safe
node.description: The 27-year-old had last been seen Saturday in Studio City, L.A. police say.

node.title: Waikato rolls out rapid antigen testing as labs reach capacity
node.description: The demand is causing a delay to process tests in the lab, with the DHB saying some tests may take up to seven days for a result.

node.title: Supreme Court rejects Trump bid to shield January 6 records
node.description: The Supreme Court already rejected Trump's emergency request to block the release of his records to the January 6 select committee.

node.title: Supreme Court to hear Colorado clash over LGBTQ rights and religious liberty
node.description: The court will decide the question of "whether applying a public-accommodation law to compel an artist to speak or stay silent violates the Free Speech Clause of the First Amendment."

node.title: Colombia to declare Pablo Escobar's "cocaine hippos" invasive species
node.description: Escobar's hippos have become a sort of local tourist attraction in the years since the kingpin was killed by police in 1993.
